page.title: 06LAW AND ORDER
page.content: {Lutterworth Police Station}has 15 policemen and one police woman. It has good facilities. A policeman on average works 40 hours a week. They have one van and four cars. The station has a canteen, a kitchen, a rest room, a front office, a Sergeants office, a C.I.D. room, and an interview room. The earliest shift starts at 8 a.m. and finishes at 4 p.m. A{Traffic Warden}works closely with the police. The{Magistrates Court}has one sitting a week and deals with 25 cases. In 1985 most cases were related to people under 30 years of age. The most common reason for arrest in Lutterworth was for stealing goods. On average 8{crimes}a week are reported. Anyone over the age of 18 can become a{Magistrate. }He or she has to sit at least 26 times a year.
